00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Function and structure definitions for random number generator hardware
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 73845 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef __CMVX_RNG_H__
00049 #define __CMVX_RNG_H__
00050 
00051 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00052 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00053 extern "C" {
00054 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #define CVMX_RNG_LOAD_ADDRESS   CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(cvmx_build_io_address(CVMX_OCT_DID_RNG, 0))
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * Structure describing the data format used for IOBDMA stores to the RNG.
00061  */
00062 typedef union {
00063     uint64_t u64;
00064     struct {
00065         uint64_t scraddr:8;
00066                     /**< the (64-bit word) location in scratchpad to write to (if len != 0) */
00067         uint64_t len:8;
00068                     /**< the number of words in the response (0 => no response) */
00069         uint64_t did:5;
00070                     /**< the ID of the device on the non-coherent bus */
00071         uint64_t subdid:3;
00072                     /**< the sub ID of the device on the non-coherent bus */
00073         uint64_t addr:40;
00074                     /**< the address that will appear in the first tick on the NCB bus */
00075     } s;
00076 } cvmx_rng_iobdma_data_t;
00077 
00078 /**
00079  * Enables the random number generator. Must be called before RNG is used
00080  */
00081 static inline void cvmx_rng_enable(void)
00082 {
00083     cvmx_rnm_ctl_status_t rnm_ctl_status;
00084     rnm_ctl_status.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_RNM_CTL_STATUS);
00085     rnm_ctl_status.s.ent_en = 1;
00086     rnm_ctl_status.s.rng_en = 1;
00087     cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_RNM_CTL_STATUS, rnm_ctl_status.u64);
00088 }
00089 
00090 /**
00091  * Reads 8 bits of random data from Random number generator
00092  *
00093  * @return random data
00094  */ static inline uint8_t cvmx_rng_get_random8(void)
00095 {
00096     return cvmx_read64_uint8(CVMX_RNG_LOAD_ADDRESS);
00097 }
00098 
00099 /**
00100  * Reads 16 bits of random data from Random number generator
00101  *
00102  * @return random data
00103  */
00104 static inline uint16_t cvmx_rng_get_random16(void)
00105 {
00106     return cvmx_read64_uint16(CVMX_RNG_LOAD_ADDRESS);
00107 }
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * Reads 32 bits of random data from Random number generator
00111  *
00112  * @return random data
00113  */
00114 static inline uint32_t cvmx_rng_get_random32(void)
00115 {
00116     return cvmx_read64_uint32(CVMX_RNG_LOAD_ADDRESS);
00117 }
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * Reads 64 bits of random data from Random number generator
00121  *
00122  * @return random data
00123  */
00124 static inline uint64_t cvmx_rng_get_random64(void)
00125 {
00126     return cvmx_read64_uint64(CVMX_RNG_LOAD_ADDRESS);
00127 }
00128 
00129 /**
00130  * Requests random data from the RNG block asynchronously using and IOBDMA operation.
00131  * The random data will be written into the cores
00132  * local memory at the specified address.  A SYNCIOBDMA
00133  * operation should be issued to stall for completion of the write.
00134  *
00135  * @param scr_addr  Address in scratch memory to put the result
00136  *                  MUST be a multiple of 8 bytes
00137  * @param num_bytes Number of bytes of random data to write at
00138  *                  scr_addr
00139  *                  MUST be a multiple of 8 bytes
00140  *
00141  * @return 0 on success
00142  *         1 on error
00143  */
00144 static inline int cvmx_rng_request_random_async(uint64_t scr_addr, uint64_t num_bytes)
00145 {
00146     cvmx_rng_iobdma_data_t data;
00147 
00148     if (num_bytes & 0x7 || scr_addr & 0x7)
00149         return (1);
00150 
00151     data.u64 = 0;
00152     /* scr_addr must be 8 byte aligned */
00153     data.s.scraddr = scr_addr >> 3;
00154     data.s.len = num_bytes >> 3;
00155     data.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_RNG;
00156     cvmx_send_single(data.u64);
00157     return (0);
00158 }
00159

00162 }
00163 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00164 #endif
00165 
00166 #endif /*  __CMVX_RNG_H__  */
